subject: Maven Surefire  and newer junit features
msgSnippet: Most of you are probably not aware of this, so I thought I d just let you know: maven-surefire plugin has 2 different junit-4 providers, and the most modern
messageBody:
Most of you are probably not aware of this, so I thought I'd just let you know:

maven-surefire plugin has 2 different junit-4 providers, and the most modern one is normally only used to run parallel tests. This provider uses JUnitCore to run the tests and should (probably) support most of the "modern" junit features.

The "thing" is that the JunitCore provider can be activated even for non-parallel tests by adding the following to your configuration:

<parallel>none</parallel>

This will force the use of the new provider in serial mode, which is fine if you just want to get access to more modern junit features.

Please note that right now you need to use 2.6-SNAPSHOT of surefire to get the latest version of the JunitCore provider. Which is really the reason I'm writing this: I'm about to release a bug-fix release of surefire (which will probably be called 2.5.1). I do not personally have time to test all the "new" junit features with the new provider, but if anyone here has time/interest in this I can get it included in the official surefire documentation.
